      Convenient method to fire an event locally
      Parameters:

      p - the player causing this event
      moves - the move sequence causing this event

    • requiredPlayers

      public abstract int[] requiredPlayers()
      The minimum and maximum number of player required for the game Must be implemented by the concrete rules of a particular game
      Returns:
      an array in the format [minPlayers, maxPlayers] (inclusive)

    • isPlayable

      public abstract boolean isPlayable(String location)
      Is a location playable? Does not guarantee validity of move.
      Parameters:
      location - the textual representation of the space (e.g., "1", "America", etc)
      Returns:
      true if currently playable, false otherwise (e.g., blocked, occupied, etc)

    • getOwner

      public abstract String getOwner(String location)
      See which player "owns" the space
      Parameters:
      location - label of the region to check
      Returns:
      the current owner of the region

    • whoseTurn

      public abstract String whoseTurn()
      Return the player who is the active player/team/group
      Returns:
      a textual representation of the player/team/group who is active

    • getLevel

      public abstract int getLevel(String location)
      Gets the level of the piece at the location
      Parameters:
      location - the location to check
      Returns:
      the level of the piece (higher numbers are 'better')

    • isValidMove

      public abstract boolean isValidMove(List<Move> moves, boolean allowPartial)
      Check to the see the move chain is valid in the game.
      Parameters:
      moves - the chain of Moves to check for validity
      allowPartial - true to allow partial moves to be considered valid
      Returns:
      true if the chain is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(List<Move> moves)
      Convenience method to check the validity of a complete move sequence
      Parameters:
      moves - the Movement sequence to verify
      Returns:
      true if the chain is valid, false otherwise

    • getValidMoves

      public abstract List<List<Move>> getValidMoves()
      Get all the valid complete move sequences for this board
      Returns:
      a list of valid, complete move sequences

    • makeMove

      public abstract boolean makeMove(List<Move> moves)
      Makes a complete move on the current game state
      Parameters:
      moves - the sequence of moves to make
      Returns:
      true if successful, false if not a valid move

      Make a duplicate of the gamestate
      Parameters:
      copyListeners - whether to keep the current listeners
      Returns:
      a new object which is a replica of this Developer Note:Child classes should call their copy constructors and return the result
